        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Nearby Share UI incorrectly appears in non-ChromeOS browsers
          (was: use after free in sharing_hub::SharingHubBubbleController::OnSharesheetClosed)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          melzhang@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam -Security_Impact-None -Security_Severity-High -external_security_report -OS-Android -OS-Chrome -OS-Fuchsia Type-Bug
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          -UI>Browser>Sharing>Nearby OS>Systems>Multidevice>Nearby
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Nearby Share UI incorrectly appears in non-ChromeOS browsers
          (was: use after free in sharing_hub::SharingHubBubbleController::OnSharesheetClosed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          melzhang@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam -Security_Impact-None -Security_Severity-High -external_security_report -OS-Android -OS-Chrome -OS-Fuchsia Type-Bug
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          -UI&gt;Browser&gt;Sharing&gt;Nearby OS&gt;Systems&gt;Multidevice&gt;Nearby
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Nearby Share should not be appearing in the sharesheet on any OS besides Chrome OS; this is undefined behavior. And this is not a security issue.<span class="line"><!---->Nearby Share should not be appearing in the sharesheet on any OS besides Chrome OS; this is undefined behavior. And this is not a security issue.<!----></span><br><br>Mel, are you the right person to take a look at this?<span class="line"><!---->Mel, are you the right person to take a look at this?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1234050#c21">Comment 21<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Aug 2, 2021, 6:07 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1234050#c21">Comment 21<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Aug 2, 2021, 6:07 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        as a developer, I could tell you the bug reason, the class SharingHubBubbleController owns "web_contents_". when we choose to close the tab, the web_contents_. is destoryed, bug the nearby bubble is still alive which means the class SharingHubBubbleController is still alive, but its raw pointer "web_contents_" had been freed and raw pointers whcih related to "web_contents_" had been freed. When we click the "close" button, the "view()" has been destroyed cause uaf, and here make a browser uaf that always means critical to our normal user.<span class="line"><!---->as a developer, I could tell you the bug reason, the class SharingHubBubbleController owns "web_contents_". when we choose to close the tab, the web_contents_. is destoryed, bug the nearby bubble is still alive which means the class SharingHubBubbleController is still alive, but its raw pointer "web_contents_" had been freed and raw pointers whcih related to "web_contents_" had been freed. When we click the "close" button, the "view()" has been destroyed cause uaf, and here make a browser uaf that always means critical to our normal user.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>
      
      
      
        
          Comment 22<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1234050#c22">Comment 22<!----></a>

          
        by

        Assigning to kristipark@. This is crashing in SharingHubBubbleController::OnSharesheetClosed when you go through the steps to reproduce (listed in C1) twice in a row. I suspect there's a lifecycle issue somewhere, something that gets destructed /set to null and isn't passed a new value between the first and second invocation.<span class="line"><!---->Assigning to kristipark@. This is crashing in SharingHubBubbleController::OnSharesheetClosed when you go through the steps to reproduce (listed in C1) twice in a row. I suspect there's a lifecycle issue somewhere, something that gets destructed /set to null and isn't passed a new value between the first and second invocation.<!----></span><br><br>wxhusst@'s reasoning in C21 makes sense to me but it's odd to me that it needs to be done twice to crash.<span class="line"><!---->wxhusst@'s reasoning in C21 makes sense to me but it's odd to me that it needs to be done twice to crash.<!----></span><br><br>Regardless, in my opinion when the tab closes, the NearbyShare bubble should also close with it (not sure if Nearby Share will have different thoughts on this). But if that's the behaviour we decide to go with, you can call SharesheetService::CloseBubble when SharingHubBubbleController destructs (with the WebContents).<span class="line"><!---->Regardless, in my opinion when the tab closes, the NearbyShare bubble should also close with it (not sure if Nearby Share will have different thoughts on this). But if that's the behaviour we decide to go with, you can call SharesheetService::CloseBubble when SharingHubBubbleController destructs (with the WebContents).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        the fix is simple, add the WebContentObserver to web_contents_.<span class="line"><!---->the fix is simple, add the WebContentObserver to web_contents_.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Nearby Share UI incorrectly appears in non-ChromeOS browsers
          (was: use after free in sharing_hub::SharingHubBubbleController::OnSharesheetClosed)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          melzhang@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam -Security_Impact-None -Security_Severity-High -external_security_report -OS-Android -OS-Chrome -OS-Fuchsia Type-Bug
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          -UI>Browser>Sharing>Nearby OS>Systems>Multidevice>Nearby
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Nearby Share UI incorrectly appears in non-ChromeOS browsers
          (was: use after free in sharing_hub::SharingHubBubbleController::OnSharesheetClosed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          melzhang@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam -Security_Impact-None -Security_Severity-High -external_security_report -OS-Android -OS-Chrome -OS-Fuchsia Type-Bug
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          -UI&gt;Browser&gt;Sharing&gt;Nearby OS&gt;Systems&gt;Multidevice&gt;Nearby
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Nearby Share should not be appearing in the sharesheet on any OS besides Chrome OS; this is undefined behavior. And this is not a security issue.<span class="line"><!---->Nearby Share should not be appearing in the sharesheet on any OS besides Chrome OS; this is undefined behavior. And this is not a security issue.<!----></span><br><br>Mel, are you the right person to take a look at this?<span class="line"><!---->Mel, are you the right person to take a look at this?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          Comment 11<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1234050#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1234050#c21">Comment 21<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Aug 2, 2021, 6:07 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1234050#c21">Comment 21<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Aug 2, 2021, 6:07 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        as a developer, I could tell you the bug reason, the class SharingHubBubbleController owns "web_contents_". when we choose to close the tab, the web_contents_. is destoryed, bug the nearby bubble is still alive which means the class SharingHubBubbleController is still alive, but its raw pointer "web_contents_" had been freed and raw pointers whcih related to "web_contents_" had been freed. When we click the "close" button, the "view()" has been destroyed cause uaf, and here make a browser uaf that always means critical to our normal user.<span class="line"><!---->as a developer, I could tell you the bug reason, the class SharingHubBubbleController owns "web_contents_". when we choose to close the tab, the web_contents_. is destoryed, bug the nearby bubble is still alive which means the class SharingHubBubbleController is still alive, but its raw pointer "web_contents_" had been freed and raw pointers whcih related to "web_contents_" had been freed. When we click the "close" button, the "view()" has been destroyed cause uaf, and here make a browser uaf that always means critical to our normal user.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Assigning to kristipark@. This is crashing in SharingHubBubbleController::OnSharesheetClosed when you go through the steps to reproduce (listed in C1) twice in a row. I suspect there's a lifecycle issue somewhere, something that gets destructed /set to null and isn't passed a new value between the first and second invocation.<span class="line"><!---->Assigning to kristipark@. This is crashing in SharingHubBubbleController::OnSharesheetClosed when you go through the steps to reproduce (listed in C1) twice in a row. I suspect there's a lifecycle issue somewhere, something that gets destructed /set to null and isn't passed a new value between the first and second invocation.<!----></span><br><br>wxhusst@'s reasoning in C21 makes sense to me but it's odd to me that it needs to be done twice to crash.<span class="line"><!---->wxhusst@'s reasoning in C21 makes sense to me but it's odd to me that it needs to be done twice to crash.<!----></span><br><br>Regardless, in my opinion when the tab closes, the NearbyShare bubble should also close with it (not sure if Nearby Share will have different thoughts on this). But if that's the behaviour we decide to go with, you can call SharesheetService::CloseBubble when SharingHubBubbleController destructs (with the WebContents).<span class="line"><!---->Regardless, in my opinion when the tab closes, the NearbyShare bubble should also close with it (not sure if Nearby Share will have different thoughts on this). But if that's the behaviour we decide to go with, you can call SharesheetService::CloseBubble when SharingHubBubbleController destructs (with the WebContents).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Nearby Share UI incorrectly appears in non-ChromeOS browsers
          (was: use after free in sharing_hub::SharingHubBubbleController::OnSharesheetClosed)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          melzhang@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam -Security_Impact-None -Security_Severity-High -external_security_report -OS-Android -OS-Chrome -OS-Fuchsia Type-Bug
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          -UI>Browser>Sharing>Nearby OS>Systems>Multidevice>Nearby
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Nearby Share UI incorrectly appears in non-ChromeOS browsers
          (was: use after free in sharing_hub::SharingHubBubbleController::OnSharesheetClosed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          melzhang@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam -Security_Impact-None -Security_Severity-High -external_security_report -OS-Android -OS-Chrome -OS-Fuchsia Type-Bug

          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Nearby Share should not be appearing in the sharesheet on any OS besides Chrome OS; this is undefined behavior. And this is not a security issue.<span class="line"><!---->Nearby Share should not be appearing in the sharesheet on any OS besides Chrome OS; this is undefined behavior. And this is not a security issue.<!----></span><br><br>Mel, are you the right person to take a look at this?<span class="line"><!---->Mel, are you the right person to take a look at this?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        as a developer, I could tell you the bug reason, the class SharingHubBubbleController owns "web_contents_". when we choose to close the tab, the web_contents_. is destoryed, bug the nearby bubble is still alive which means the class SharingHubBubbleController is still alive, but its raw pointer "web_contents_" had been freed and raw pointers whcih related to "web_contents_" had been freed. When we click the "close" button, the "view()" has been destroyed cause uaf, and here make a browser uaf that always means critical to our normal user.<span class="line"><!---->as a developer, I could tell you the bug reason, the class SharingHubBubbleController owns "web_contents_". when we choose to close the tab, the web_contents_. is destoryed, bug the nearby bubble is still alive which means the class SharingHubBubbleController is still alive, but its raw pointer "web_contents_" had been freed and raw pointers whcih related to "web_contents_" had been freed. When we click the "close" button, the "view()" has been destroyed cause uaf, and here make a browser uaf that always means critical to our normal user.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Assigning to kristipark@. This is crashing in SharingHubBubbleController::OnSharesheetClosed when you go through the steps to reproduce (listed in C1) twice in a row. I suspect there's a lifecycle issue somewhere, something that gets destructed /set to null and isn't passed a new value between the first and second invocation.<span class="line"><!---->Assigning to kristipark@. This is crashing in SharingHubBubbleController::OnSharesheetClosed when you go through the steps to reproduce (listed in C1) twice in a row. I suspect there's a lifecycle issue somewhere, something that gets destructed /set to null and isn't passed a new value between the first and second invocation.<!----></span><br><br>wxhusst@'s reasoning in C21 makes sense to me but it's odd to me that it needs to be done twice to crash.<span class="line"><!---->wxhusst@'s reasoning in C21 makes sense to me but it's odd to me that it needs to be done twice to crash.<!----></span><br><br>Regardless, in my opinion when the tab closes, the NearbyShare bubble should also close with it (not sure if Nearby Share will have different thoughts on this). But if that's the behaviour we decide to go with, you can call SharesheetService::CloseBubble when SharingHubBubbleController destructs (with the WebContents).<span class="line"><!---->Regardless, in my opinion when the tab closes, the NearbyShare bubble should also close with it (not sure if Nearby Share will have different thoughts on this). But if that's the behaviour we decide to go with, you can call SharesheetService::CloseBubble when SharingHubBubbleController destructs (with the WebContents).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I'm not sure whether we should be avoiding the merge here, my understanding is that this would mean M94 would be impacted on stable channel (where this bug was previously Security_Impact-None). On top of that, M95 is being skipped for CrOS, so it wouldn't be fixed until 96.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure whether we should be avoiding the merge here, my understanding is that this would mean M94 would be impacted on stable channel (where this bug was previously Security_Impact-None). On top of that, M95 is being skipped for CrOS, so it wouldn't be fixed until 96.<!----></span><br><br>Can someone from the security team (amyressler@?) confirm what the right move is here?<span class="line"><!---->Can someone from the security team (amyressler@?) confirm what the right move is here?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Nearby Share UI incorrectly appears in non-ChromeOS browsers
          (was: use after free in sharing_hub::SharingHubBubbleController::OnSharesheetClosed)
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          melzhang@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam -Security_Impact-None -Security_Severity-High -external_security_report -OS-Android -OS-Chrome -OS-Fuchsia Type-Bug
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          -UI>Browser>Sharing>Nearby OS>Systems>Multidevice>Nearby
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Nearby Share UI incorrectly appears in non-ChromeOS browsers
          (was: use after free in sharing_hub::SharingHubBubbleController::OnSharesheetClosed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          melzhang@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Restrict-View-SecurityTeam -Security_Impact-None -Security_Severity-High -external_security_report -OS-Android -OS-Chrome -OS-Fuchsia Type-Bug
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          -UI&gt;Browser&gt;Sharing&gt;Nearby OS&gt;Systems&gt;Multidevice&gt;Nearby
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Nearby Share should not be appearing in the sharesheet on any OS besides Chrome OS; this is undefined behavior. And this is not a security issue.<span class="line"><!---->Nearby Share should not be appearing in the sharesheet on any OS besides Chrome OS; this is undefined behavior. And this is not a security issue.<!----></span><br><br>Mel, are you the right person to take a look at this?<span class="line"><!---->Mel, are you the right person to take a look at this?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        as a developer, I could tell you the bug reason, the class SharingHubBubbleController owns "web_contents_". when we choose to close the tab, the web_contents_. is destoryed, bug the nearby bubble is still alive which means the class SharingHubBubbleController is still alive, but its raw pointer "web_contents_" had been freed and raw pointers whcih related to "web_contents_" had been freed. When we click the "close" button, the "view()" has been destroyed cause uaf, and here make a browser uaf that always means critical to our normal user.<span class="line"><!---->as a developer, I could tell you the bug reason, the class SharingHubBubbleController owns "web_contents_". when we choose to close the tab, the web_contents_. is destoryed, bug the nearby bubble is still alive which means the class SharingHubBubbleController is still alive, but its raw pointer "web_contents_" had been freed and raw pointers whcih related to "web_contents_" had been freed. When we click the "close" button, the "view()" has been destroyed cause uaf, and here make a browser uaf that always means critical to our normal user.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Assigning to kristipark@. This is crashing in SharingHubBubbleController::OnSharesheetClosed when you go through the steps to reproduce (listed in C1) twice in a row. I suspect there's a lifecycle issue somewhere, something that gets destructed /set to null and isn't passed a new value between the first and second invocation.<span class="line"><!---->Assigning to kristipark@. This is crashing in SharingHubBubbleController::OnSharesheetClosed when you go through the steps to reproduce (listed in C1) twice in a row. I suspect there's a lifecycle issue somewhere, something that gets destructed /set to null and isn't passed a new value between the first and second invocation.<!----></span><br><br>wxhusst@'s reasoning in C21 makes sense to me but it's odd to me that it needs to be done twice to crash.<span class="line"><!---->wxhusst@'s reasoning in C21 makes sense to me but it's odd to me that it needs to be done twice to crash.<!----></span><br><br>Regardless, in my opinion when the tab closes, the NearbyShare bubble should also close with it (not sure if Nearby Share will have different thoughts on this). But if that's the behaviour we decide to go with, you can call SharesheetService::CloseBubble when SharingHubBubbleController destructs (with the WebContents).<span class="line"><!---->Regardless, in my opinion when the tab closes, the NearbyShare bubble should also close with it (not sure if Nearby Share will have different thoughts on this). But if that's the behaviour we decide to go with, you can call SharesheetService::CloseBubble when SharingHubBubbleController destructs (with the WebContents).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

          Comment 34<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1234050#c34">Comment 34<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        This bug requires manual review: We are only 11 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 11 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: govind@(Android), harrysouders@(iOS), matthewjoseph@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: govind@(Android), harrysouders@(iOS), matthewjoseph@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>

        <slot></slot>
      </label>

      <input id="filter" type="text">
      <i class="material-icons">search</i>
    
      <form id="issueHotlistsForm">
        
      <div class="user-hotlists">
        
      </div>
    
        <h3 class="medium-heading">Create new hotlist</h3>
        <div class="input-grid">
          <label for="newHotlistName">New hotlist name:</label>
          <input type="text" name="newHotlistName">
        </div>
        
      <br>
      
    
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button class="de-emphasized discard-button">
            Discard
          </chops-button>
          <chops-button class="emphasized">
            Save changes
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </form>
    
    </chops-dialog>
    <mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog id="update-issue-hotlists"></mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog>


        
      <div class="snackbar-container" aria-live="polite">
        
      </div>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
